website_summaries.verdict: From bounce to grip, it's a solid medicine ball.
pros: Incorporates thick rubber walls, easy-grip textured surface, and adjustable bounce to accommodate numerous workout styles
cons: On the firm side, but this is only a concern for consumers who prefer a softer model

customer_reviews.title: Cracked within 4 months with soft ground use
customer_reviews.text: SPRI is usually reliable but this particular medball cracked within 4 months of purchasing. I never used it on anything harder then grass, so it baffles me how it would crack. Unfortunately they only have a 90 limited warranty. My other medball is Nike brand and I’ve had it for 9 years. It’s still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Ender

customer_reviews.title: Hands down, The best Medicine ball on the market.
customer_reviews.text: There are many medicine balls on the market, and I've used my fair share. The SPIRI Xerball is in my opinion the best, most versatile ball out there. It's durable, weather resistant, and easy to clean. I have purchased most of the available weight options and have been pleased with every single one. The SPIRI Xerballs are my favorite, and most used piece of fitness equipment I own.
customer_reviews.author: Everett Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Quality Fun
customer_reviews.text: There are less expensive and more expensive balls to consider. As one who is serious about exercise, I considered the more expensive for better quality and durability, but after working with SPRI balls I discovered they have the utmost quality for the price. I use my SPRI balls almost every day before my weight training - they're different, they're fun, and they improve my focus. I highly recommend the use of medicine balls in your exercise program and SPRI balls will not disappoint in quality, feel, and enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: DayLight

customer_reviews.title: Great study ball
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy ball. I've only just got it so I can't personally say how it will wear. However these are exactly the same ones my gym uses and they are holding up very well after years of use. I am recently temporarily home confined and can't get to the gym. I can do all kinds of exercises with this ball. Plus it came already blown up. Which I wasn't sure if it did, since I had read some other brands hadn't. Thankfully I have amazon prime since I can't get out and go shopping.
customer_reviews.author: WIBadgerFan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This is used a couple times a week by a 75 year old lady. After just 6 months the ball split open! If used by anyone actually fit would probably not last a month.
customer_reviews.author: John L Hooper

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Best I especially like bc of the size and shape of a regular basketball...and has nice texture so gives me a good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: 2lb perfect
customer_reviews.text: tried 6 lb ball too heavy for arthritic thumbs. 2lb ball is perfect for our core exercise routine.
customer_reviews.author: steven j romero

customer_reviews.title: Superb inflatable medicine ball, with basketball-like surface for grip.
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality. I got this kind of medicine ball because of familiarity with Mitch Gaylord's "G-ball." I like the inflated ball with basketball-like surface that allows good grip. It is a little larger than the G-ball, so a few things I do with it don't work quite as well, unless my fingers were to grow a few more inches. That aside, this is very high quality, worth the price I paid and a big help in losing weight and adding strength.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect for slams
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my cement driveway. I place a yoga map on the driveway and slam away!
customer_reviews.author: readerrunnermom

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not bad,the quality is good,but it always feels a little bit wrong,but it’s all trivial.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracked after only a few months use
customer_reviews.text: We typically buy from Power Systems but decided to give this product a try. Company offers 90 day warranty and stated that product would show any defects after a couple uses. Definitely would not buy again as company does not stand behind their product. Power Systems replaced one of their med-balls after a year of use when it cracked no questions asked.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Litten

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy medicine ball and works as intended,
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great medicine ball
customer_reviews.text: I really like this medicine ball. It does everything that I wanted to have it do. It feels like a basketball so it's a little bit hard on the hands when using it for slam work. But it's very stable and feels solid all the way through so no shifting of the internal contents of the ball when you're trying to do work.
customer_reviews.author: AG mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for home workouts.
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 3 weeks... great tool for my home workouts.
customer_reviews.author: DiMic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I like the Valero balls too but the SPRI seems a bit sturdier and I like the grip pattern a bit better. I love throw downs so I am pretty hard on these things and break one open every 6 months or so. I have had this one for about 4 months and it is holding up well. I have had several Valeros (and would buy another one) but I think I like the SPRI better. I'll buy another SPRI when this one breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Its not even a circle. It has a flat side to it. It's quite hilarious just trying to roll it. I thought filling it up with more air would help but nope! Save your money and try another brand. Quality control is obviously not important to this company.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent high quality ball, works great. Other person may have gotten a counterfeit ball. This genuine spri ball is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PolarPop

customer_reviews.title: Medicine ball greatness
customer_reviews.text: It has a very comfortable "basketball" feel and is very sturdy. It is not meant to be used as a slam ball but will still take some good lickings if wanted. It will bounce off a brick wall well enough but not give enough bounce off of the ground (a little much to expect from such a heavy ball). Great medicine ball.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Longtin

customer_reviews.title: Now I actually have to workout!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and quality. Easy to handle. Don't seem to get slick when used. And I'm a sweat-er! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pines65

customer_reviews.title: great ball
customer_reviews.text: does it's job, easy to work with. 6lbs isn't much, but good for the level i need for my workout. i use it in a routine set up by a personal trainer, so i do limited work with it. as a brand, i am happy with SPRI, though this is a pretty simple product . . .
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: The ball is fine and it will give you a workout
customer_reviews.text: The ball is fine and it will give you a workout. Right now, I'm just concerned about durability; and only time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand Available
customer_reviews.text: High quality weighted fitness ball. Don't even think about wasting your money on any other brand. Previously purchased a pair of 8 lb. balls.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory J. Rummo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. My husband broke his last one throwing it to the ground. It was leather, and the seam broke. This one bounces. Feels like a basketball. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Noinod5

customer_reviews.title: excellent weighted ball
customer_reviews.text: We bought a number of this series of ball, as the feel is great, and the material as well. Exactly what we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Love the "basketball" style
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that 15lbs seems a lot heavier than I was imagining. I like to consider myself in shape, so if you are just starting out, a lighter weight would probably be more ideal. Otherwise, great workout, love the basketball style, doesn't get as slippery with sweat as the leather ones do. Great product, great price, and great workout!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected and like the ones in the gyms and nice hotels.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Although a drop pricey in the mid-$40, this is what they all seem to cost. I use when I do squats, push-ups (both hands on the ball for balance) and also hold in between knees while doing leg lifts (for lower abs). Lots of versatility and no issues regarding the thick rubber surface. A very good product that I expect to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: AWiseGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great ball. Pebbled grain of the ball is superior ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. Pebbled grain of the ball is superior to the ball I previously used which has a rougher grain and caused blisters. It's a new purchase but so far it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Good Product..Quality can’t be beat
customer_reviews.text: Great ball super sturdy. Nice bounce to this ball with 30lbs weight...Very Impressed..Definitely will purchase more of these
customer_reviews.author: JenfitTrainer

customer_reviews.title: Great All in One Medicine Ball for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great medicine ball for the price. I have the 20 pound version and it is great. If you are looking for something you can do medicine ball slams, wall ball tosses, and other medicine ball exercises I found this to be a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have several different weight medicine balls made by SPRI and I am pleased with all of them. I believe they are made just as well as any of the other brands and are significantly less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Greegor

customer_reviews.title: worked great just had a very short life
customer_reviews.text: worked great just had a very short life , it just came apart , it broke in half. I would buy again if I though the first one was just a bad ball but for the time it was used the cost was very high. It was not used outside and always on a smooth floor.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Ball
customer_reviews.text: Best medicine ball I've ever used. Gym quailty ball at a resonale price on Amazon. I have other medicine balls but this is by far the best. I plan on buying more from this brand in the different weight specs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I can only speak for the 30 pounder. Even if you are a huge and strong gym-goer, keep in mind that 30 lbs is HEAVY for a medicine ball. This thing practically shakes the entire gym when I do floor slams (something I am neither proud of nor enjoy, but unfortunately the turf area floor is wood, concrete doesn't have this issue). Note that there is not a lot of bounce to this thing when doing wall tosses.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in visual aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: The product is a 12 lb medicine ball but I was surprised that it looked faded in the one side almost like it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I will be buying more in different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: maj1177

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and well built.  Light enough to dribble while strengthening wrists/forearms.  Actual weight was 1.8 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Good feel to it - good grip. Light enough to dribble while strengthening wrists/forearms. Actual weight was 1.8 lbs. Purchased the 4 lb ball as well and it was same quality (actual weight was 3.8 lbs).
customer_reviews.author: Cottontop

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great medicine ball. At first I was a little shocked at how expensive these things are but they work great!
customer_reviews.author: TonyS

customer_reviews.title: I use it on a daily basis and am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The ball meets my expectations. I use it on a daily basis and am happy with it. I would recommend this medicine ball to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the one at the gym, so it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mary G.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Use it to throw vertically and catch from a bench. Works.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a medicine ball with good bounce and grip
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a medicine ball with good bounce and grip, and this one is perfect in both categories!
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Received a used ball
customer_reviews.text: After opening the package the ball that was inside had been used multiple times.!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just like the 6 lb one I already own
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: pretty good
customer_reviews.text: the outter layer peels chips away fairly easily. Otherwise a good ball
customer_reviews.author: Seth Reed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves his medicine ball. Uses it for building core strength.
customer_reviews.author: Dorene Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best medicine ball. Heavy duty and can be found usually at your local gym.
customer_reviews.author: azwineluvr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality of the ball is excellent. Price is good as well. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: GO HARD OR GO HOME!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this medicine ball! If you are serious about your training, add this to the mix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this ball
customer_reviews.text: This is the best quality of the three brands in my gym, I am impressed!!
customer_reviews.author: Sashabeagle

customer_reviews.title: medicine ball
customer_reviews.text: love it! I enjoy the 10 # more, however, this gives a great workout.It is hard, make sure anyone you are working out with knows it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Fuhrer

customer_reviews.title: spri medicine ball - excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent - it is as advertised and even better. Will not need to add any air. You won't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: falcon

customer_reviews.title: and looks good. Same ball that a lot of gyms have
customer_reviews.text: It's everything that I expected. Well made, and looks good. Same ball that a lot of gyms have.
customer_reviews.author: Docforkids

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been exactly as advertised. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lomisalmon

customer_reviews.title: He was delighted with it
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift for my Grandson. He was delighted with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for exercise routine .. beats free weights in the home
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. This is my 5th SPRI ball for ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. This is my 5th SPRI ball for my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Handle
customer_reviews.text: This medicine ball is so easy to hold on to & move around for my workouts. At 2 lbs I thought it wouldn't be much of a challenge, but at the end of my 50 min. medicine ball DVD workout, my arms & core are screaming (in the best way of course)!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Hempel

customer_reviews.title: Great product didn't realize how heavy it was going to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product didn't realize how heavy it was going to be until i received it. Will be used happily for myself and my clients to add some resistance to workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Attisso Yves Gnohoue

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This medicine ball is perfect for my level of exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great balls!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is top the line. A little better bounce wud help but really a quality all around med ball. Grip, structure, bounce (Is great, just not the best) to get a quality med ball at a reasonable price this is your ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jaga222

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: This product has done exactly as it was supposed to . My son and I use this to build his basketball strength. Bounces if dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting a lot of value out of this item - my balance and core strength is much better since using this ball three times a week. I did not realize how much of a workout you get by simply moving the ball around - Yes, I would buy another
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2 # True Medicine Ball
customer_reviews.text: This is the exact same ball used by Gilad in his Lord of the Abs series. It's a basketball sized ball with the same sort of nubs on it. I love it, it's exactly what I wanted, price is great!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality medicine ball. The texture, fit and finish of the ball is superior in quality to the Valeo and TKO balls. You can't go wrong buying this ball. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Good Medicine Ball
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the "basketball" texture/feeling of the ball but it is well constructed and works great. Shipped fast and was undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaDeltaKilo

customer_reviews.title: The heavy ball
customer_reviews.text: It meets my expectations. I is good for my exercises. I am not sure what else to say about it,
customer_reviews.author: Judas

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use it for squats. It is a bit heavier than I typically use, but adjusting to it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol  Emert

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with SPRI
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my fitness studio and at a great price. You really can't go wrong with SPRI. I can't wait to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Barnum

customer_reviews.title: not over done and didn't know bouncing med-balls came in this size so I love it
customer_reviews.text: packing was simple, not over done and didn't know bouncing med-balls came in this size so I love it
customer_reviews.author: AMAZON SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Ball was as advertised. Heavier than I thought a 25lb ball would be. I would consider a 20lb if I had to make a similar purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Premium price...very poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered March 5th split bad @ air hole in multiple directions on April 13th. I added no air...used it exactly how it was delivered. Used less than 10 times only for ball slams by girls and guys...20 reps X 3 sets. Either I got a bad one or these are definitely not worth the money.obviously.
customer_reviews.author: ThaiBoxer

customer_reviews.title: Great Medicine Ball
customer_reviews.text: The grip on this ball is fantastic. The ball is similar to a basketball, in this ones case, a 25 lb basketball. I received it in short time. Negatives: Could have been packaged better as the ball had almost broken out of the box. Could have had more information material. The price is a little steep but the shipping price made up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Livengood

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: Came with a lump and broken air valve. Never replaced it don't really care but giving it 2 stars for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Algene

customer_reviews.title: Good for medium training.
customer_reviews.text: Good for warm ups and having something to do when bored. It's a tad slippery when brand new but that quickly fixes it's self,
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: ... fit class in our martial arts school Product is great
customer_reviews.text: We are starting a fit class in our martial arts school Product is great
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R Shierling

product_meta.title: SPRI Xerball Medicine Ball Thick Walled Durable Construction with Textured Surface (Available in 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 15, 18, 20, 25, 30 Pounds)
product_meta.description: The SPRI Xerball is a unique and versatile, total-body training tool that helps develop muscular strength, endurance, power, stability, and joint integrity. The color-coded Xerball will bounce and maintain its shape, and it is extremely durable. Redesigned with comfort and function in mind. Medicine balls can be used for a wide range of applications — from slow and controlled moves all the way up to very fast-moving, ultra-dynamic ones. They can be held onto, tossed, bounced, and even slammed against nearly any surface, like rubber or hardwood floors, grass or artificial turf, even concrete. Medicine Ball will retain shape after repeated use and is built to a commercial grade quality and designed for gyms and clubs to be 100 times a day versus 100 times a year in a home gym.
feature_bullets: CLASSIC MED BALL: Body training tool that helps develop muscular strength, endurance, power, stability and joint integrity
THICK WALLED: Thick walls increase durability and extend the life of the ball and the higher rubber content provides a better bounce - add air to increase the bounce and add variety to your workout
TEXTURED BASKETBALL-LIKE SURFACE: Allows for a more comfortable and secure grip even during the most strenuous workouts

BUILT FOR REPEATED USE: Medicine Ball will retain shape after repeated use and is built to a professional grade quality and designed for commercial gyms and clubs to be used 100 times a day versus 100 times a year in a home gym
BOLD COLOR CODED: Easy to read weight stamps allow for quick identification of weight desired
